title: Ping is consistently too high.
body:
I've been playing with ping consistently between the high 80s to 110 range. Though I know this isn't unplayable, it feels less responsive than it should. League is the only game I have issues like this with as I get sub 30 ping in CS:GO and sub 50 ping in Overwatch. Been trying to troubleshoot this for a while and finally ran a trace route but I'm not sure how to read it and I don't know if there's a problem on my end, my ISP's end, or Riot's end. Here it is:

Traceroute has startedâ€¦

12  104.160.131.3 (104.160.131.3)  94.447 ms  94.006 ms  94.473 ms

From what I can tell the last three hops are all Riot servers and that seems to be where the latency comes in. Is this typical? Any help would be appreciated.

replies.body:
Based on this, it looks like things start getting crappy when you leave your local network but it's also not routing directly to the game server.  Run another traceroute but use [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and have 104.160.131.1 (NA game server) as your destination for a few minutes to get a more visible overview.  

You should also run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to configure your DNS and rule out any local possibilities!

Thanks!  As suspected, it looks like you're having some huge spikes upon hopping to your ISP's routing, which can cause disconnects as well.  Make sure to go through the connection guide, change your DNS, and even power cycle your router.  If that doesn't do the trick, you may need to present these logs to your ISP to see what the deal is with that node.
